name: checkmate
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`checkmate` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/tetratelabs/terraform-provider-checkmate).

nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/tetratelabs/terraform-provider-checkmate)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-checkmate` repo](/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-checkmate` repo](https://github.com/tetratelabs/terraform-provider-checkmate/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/tetratelabs/terraform-provider-checkmate)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,

> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-checkmate` repo](https://github.com/tetratelabs/terraform-provider-checkmate/issues).

provider.description:
The provider type for the checkmate package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

consecutiveSuccesses.description:
Number of consecutive successes required before the check is considered successful overall. Defaults to 1. If there are
fewer retries remaining than this number, the check will fail immediately

interval.description: Interval in milliseconds between attemps. Default 200

retries.description: Max number of times to retry a failure. Default 5

timeout.description: Overall timeout in milliseconds for the check before giving up. Default 5000

timeout.description: Overall timeout in milliseconds for the check before giving up. Default 5000

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering HttpHealth resources.
